post_text:
The Colusa County Public Health Department issued a shelter in place, effective immediately, in response to the spread of COVID-19. The order is in place through Friday, April 10.

CUSD Schools will remain closed through Friday, April 17 for the scheduled Spring Break. Please check back frequently for updates as the a shelter in place was also issued by Gavin Newsom, California State Governor, with no end date. Online learning will continue through April 10th.

REMINDER: Student safety is our #1 priority!!! If you plan on driving students for an athletic event, you must to complete a volunteer packet, get a fingerprint clearance and provide proof of insurance!

Please visit our website at https://colusausd-ca.schoolloop.com/pf4/cms2/view_page?d=x&group_id=1522740783946&vdid=i4ndb1wu2z934h to access the forms or visit the Superintendent's Office at 745 Tenth Street. Please email ajennings@colusa.k12.ca.us for a complete list of items you will need to provide.

post_text: The AQI number has jumped significantly (from 34 to 42) in the last hour. It has not reached 55, but seems headed that way quickly. We're back to no outside activities for CUSD student.
text: The AQI number has jumped significantly (from 34 to 42) in the last hour. It has not reached 55, but seems headed that way quickly. We're back to no outside activities for CUSD student.

post_text:
Update / Correction:
Currently the Air Quality measure is at 30.6

Using this measure, the air becomes unhealthy at 55, not the 150 stated below. Sorry for any confusion.

But in any case be assured we are monitoring the situation and will keep students inside if the air quality moves into the unhealthy category.
text:
Update / Correction:
Currently the Air Quality measure is at 30.6

Using this measure, the air becomes unhealthy at 55, not the 150 stated below. Sorry for any confusion.

But in any case be assured we are monitoring the situation and will keep students inside if the air quality moves into the unhealthy category.

post_text:
Air Quality Index in Colusa has improved.

Right now the reading is at 28. Guidelines say 150 is when the air quality becomes unhealthy. We will allow outside activities as long as the monitoring station reports AQI below the unhealthy level. Obviously, we may limit outside activities if the AQI reading is approaching but still below the unhealthy readings - just to be cautious.

We monitor the site suggested by the Colusa County Air Pollution Control District. You can follow the readings at:

https://tools.airfire.org/monitoring/v4#!/?category=PM2.5_nowcast&centerlat=39.2429&centerlon=-122.0993&zoom=9

post_text:
Outdoor activities will not be held at CUSD today due to poor air quality. PE, recess, and any sports practices will be held indoors only.

Parents should consider transporting their students to school. The Air Quality Advisory Board recommends that students not ride their bicycles or walk until the air quality improves.

Parents should consider transporting their students to school. The Air Quality Advisory Board recommends that students not ride their bicycles or walk until the air quality improves.

post_text:
BPS has one full section of Transitional Kindergarten (TK). Currently we have only one student on the waiting list.



We will open another section of TK if there is sufficient demand. If you have a student you would like placed on the waiting list, please call the school office at 530-458-5853 if you have any questions.



Please help us spread the word to any parent of a student who will turn 5 between 9/01/18 and 12/02/18 this year.



Thank you.

shared_text:
Colusa Unified School District
November 15, 2017 at 3:01 PM ¬∑

Hello Colusa Unified,

Please be advised that tomorrow, Thursday, November 16th, our local law enforcement will be running active shooter drills at the Parelli Plant near Colusa High School‚Äôs football field. Our district was just today made aware of this drill.

We understand the timing of this drill is not the best given yesterday‚Äôs incident in Corning. However, we also believe it is important that our local authorities hone their skills for the safety and greater good of our community and kids.

The drill will begin at 8:00 AM and run until approximately 5:30 PM. During the exercise, the officers will be discharging ‚Äúsimunitions‚Äù. These are cartridges which sound like real ammunition, but fire a paint/dye filled plastic bubble which has a range of less than 150 feet. The simulated ‚Äúgun shots‚Äù will begin sometime around 11:00 AM.

Please talk with your students as you feel necessary / appropriate to make them aware that this is ONLY a drill.

I appreciate your attention to this matter.

Dwayne Newman
Superintendent

post_text:
CUSD Facebook Friends - please help us spread the word:

KINDER CAMP STARTS TOMORROW!
Due to unexpected circumstances we were unable to mail individual invitations to our yearly Kinder Camp.

CORRECTION: Apparently the letters were mailed. Yeah!

So just a Reminder:

If you have an incoming TK or Kindergarten student please consider having them attend. The Camp will run from 9:00 - 11:00am August 8, 9, and 10. The camp is helpful for students, but attendance is not required.

The three days are filled with fun activities designed to help new students settle into the routines of school and learn their way around the Burchfield Primary School campus.

A meeting for the parents of Kinder Campers will he held from 10:30 - 11:00am on Thursday August 10th. Even if your child cannot attend Camp, it would be helpful for parents of all TK and Kindergarten student to attend if possible.

I apologize for the short notice and any inconvenience.

Thank You,
Mr. Newman
Superintendent

post_text:
NEW BURCHFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL PRINCIPAL NAMED

Mr. Jesse Rodriguez has accepted the Principal position at BPS. The district had sixteen applicants for the position, and narrowed the field to six for interviews. "We had a very strong group of candidates, which was surprising given the late date" said Superintendent Dwayne Newman. "I'm pleased and excited that Mr. Rodriguez was the successful applicant" he added.

Mr. Rodriguez has over two decades of elementary teaching experience. He will take over for outgoing Principal Mrs. Clair Toth who accepted a position with the Sutter County Office of Education.

A more extensive biography of Mr. Rodriguez will be posted. Check back soon.

Mr. Rodriguez has over two decades of elementary teaching experience. He will take over for outgoing Principal Mrs. Clair Toth who accepted a position with the Sutter County Office of Education.

A more extensive biography of Mr. Rodriguez will be posted. Check back soon.

CELEBRATION OF LIFE SCHEDULED

Kathy Aplanalp's family has announced that a gathering is planned at Chico Elks Lodge, 1705 Manzanita Ave. from 1-3p.m. on July 22. Light refreshments will be served. Everyone is invited to stop by and share stories and smiles in celebration of the life of this amazing woman.
text:
CELEBRATION OF LIFE SCHEDULED

Kathy Aplanalp's family has announced that a gathering is planned at Chico Elks Lodge, 1705 Manzanita Ave. from 1-3p.m. on July 22. Light refreshments will be served. Everyone is invited to stop by and share stories and smiles in celebration of the life of this amazing woman.

post_text:
BURCHFIELD PLAYGROUND CLOSED TEMPORARILY

BPS playground gates will be closed and locked until the District determines the extent of a sinkhole which has appeared near the kindergarten building. Crews are working on the issue. Playground gates will be unlocked when it is safe to open the area to public use.

Please warn your children / students to stay off the playgrounds until this issue is resolved. Thank you for your cooperation.

shared_text:
Rosemary Hicks is with Lupe Espindola and 80 others.
May 23, 2017 at 10:31 AM ¬∑

On behalf of the Kretz and Aplanalp family, with great sadness we share with you that our beloved daughter, mother, sister and friend Kathy has moved on from this earth. We know Kathy is loved by so many and we will soon be gathering for a celebration of her spirit. We will share those details as we confirm location and dates. For now in her honor, keep your fondest memories in mind. We are working on setting up something for her children Ivy and Daemon, two of her greatest gifts to this world.....‚ù§üåª

post_text:
SCHOOL WILL RESUME TUESDAY 2/14
At this time we feel it is safe to resume school tomorrow, Tuesday, February 14, 2017. All schools will start and operate on their normal schedules.

We would like to thank Mr. Mike West, Colusa County Superintendent of Schools, the Colusa County Sheriff‚Äôs Office, and all of our emergency responders for their guidance and assistance during this incident. Our staff will remain at a heightened state of awareness until the situation at the Oroville Dam is declared safe.

This is a good time to remind parents of the absolute necessity of supplying your child‚Äôs school with current and accurate contact information. Please make sure to inform the school any time your phone number or email address changes.

Thank you.
Dwayne Newman
Superintendent
Colusa Unified School District.

post_text:
School Closure Monday

Hello,

This is Dwayne Newman, Colusa Unified Superintendent. Due to the situation with the Oroville Dam and because we are unsure of the effects any breach may have, we are going to cancel school for tomorrow, Monday, February 13, 2017.

There is no information that Colusa itself is in danger at this time. We are doing this out of an abundance of caution and because many of our staff commute from areas which may be effected. Please continue to watch the district website and Facebook pages for further updates.

Our thoughts and prayers go out to those impacted by this event. Everyone please be safe.

post_text:
At 11am on November 11, 1918 the guns fell silent over European battlefields, and the First World War drew to a close. For nearly 5 decades this date was remembered by Americans as Armistice Day. After WW II and the Korean War, the name was changed to honor the men and women who have served our country in the Armed forces, and we now call it Veterans Day.



As 98th anniversary of that hour grows near, we take a moment and remember the service and sacrifices of our veterans.



To those of you who have served:
text:

As 98th anniversary of that hour grows near, we take a moment and remember the service and sacrifices of our veterans.



To those of you who have served:

post_text:
SAFETY UPDATE
Parents, Guardians, and Members of the Colusa USD Community;

There have been multiple reports in the news of people in clown costumes frightening children (and adults) across the country. In some instances these ‚Äúclowns‚Äù have created social media pages and used those venues to issue threats.

There are rumors here in Colusa about such activities, but at this point I have checked with Colusa PD and we have no information that any threat has been made toward our schools. The Colusa PD is aware of the situation, and will alert us immediately should such a threat occur.

Please reassure your children that our schools and school events, are safe. Help them understand that we will always be vigilant in protecting them from any threat. The community will be informed immediately via multiple methods of communication should any threat occur.

If you notice something suspicious, please contact your child's school or dial 458-7777 for Colusa PD or 911 as appropriate.

Thank you for helping us keep CUSD a safe place for kids.

Mr. Newman

CUSD Superintendent

post_text:
PLEASE NOTE:

Visitors to CHS, please be aware that the cafeteria restrooms have switched places. Since 1964 when the school was built, the Men's has been on the right and the Women's on the left. To create the space necessary for ADA compliant restrooms, and to keep the same number of stalls, we had to move the Men's to the left, and women's to the right.

If you visit CHS, and need to use the restroom, please be careful to enter the correct door. If you don't pay attention to the switched locations, you may find yourself in the wrong restroom!!

Also, the new AC unit in the CHS gym is working well. Come out to support the Volleyball Team and enjoy the comfort - thanks to our Measure A Bond program.

CHECK OUT THE COLUSA HIGH APP

Go to the app store on your smart phone and search "Colusa High School". Download the App - it's free! All your school resources will be available right from your phone.

Want to see what time 2nd period ends? It's there!
Want to see the spring sports schedules? They're there!
Feel the need to check your student's Math Grade on School Loop? It's there!
Need information from the daily bulletin? It's there!
Time to add lunch money for your child's account through the "MySchoolBucks" system? It's there.

And much more!!! Check it out.

post_text:
BURCHFIELD CLASS LISTS POSTED

Class lists are posted on the BPS office windows.

BPS will not be mailing home notifications of class assignment this year. The labor, stamps, and materials have become too costly. We are working to integrate a new computer system which would inform parents electronically - through text, email, or an automated phone call. But that is in the future. For now, if you are eager to know which teacher your child will have this year, please stop by and check the posted lists.

Looking forward to another great year!

post_text:
We are sad to announce that Mrs. Arvizo-Espinoza, who came to us last summer as the BPS principal, has submitted her resignation effective at the end of this year. We thank her for her service this year, and wish her all the best as she moves on to bigger and better things.

The process for hiring a replacement will begin immediately. As we have done in the past, we will be forming an interview committee comprised of staff, parents, community members, a board member and administrators. See the CUSD web site for more details.

The process for hiring a replacement will begin immediately. As we have done in the past, we will be forming an interview committee comprised of staff, parents, community members, a board member and administrators. See the CUSD web site for more details.

post_text: Our Citizen's Oversight Committee met for the first time last night. As of this time, the Bonds are scheduled to be sold in mid-April. Our financial advisor tells us we will save about $100,000 by selling the bonds all at one time. Additionally, the district will save a "substantial" amount because we can shorten the term of the bonds from 30 to 25 years. Stay tuned for more information.
text: Our Citizen's Oversight Committee met for the first time last night. As of this time, the Bonds are scheduled to be sold in mid-April. Our financial advisor tells us we will save about $100,000 by selling the bonds all at one time. Additionally, the district will save a "substantial" amount because we can shorten the term of the bonds from 30 to 25 years. Stay tuned for more information.

Colusa High School
December 18, 2014 at 9:26 PM ¬∑

Tonight, the Colusa High School gymnasium takes on a much deserved change. In front of family, friends and loved ones, Dr. Don Bransford was honored tonight by the Colusa Unified School District Board President, Lincoln Forry, by renaming the CHS gymnasium to now be called...The Don Bransford Gymnasium. Dr. Bransford, this is much deserved for your 30+ years of work and support for our kids and our community. Thank you to all of Dr. Bransford's family for making it out to this special tribute. We owe you so much more than we can possibly give.

post_text:
Parents of Burchfield students: We have been informed by the City of Colusa that there is nothing which can be done about the large puddle that forms on the north side of BPS on very rainy days. Apparently, when the storm sewers were originally installed, the outflow pipes were significantly smaller than needed. Because of those small pipes, the system simply cannot drain fast enough to keep up with the runoff from a storm.

At any rate, on rainy days please try to avoid picking up your child at the Lafayette / 4th Street corner just north of the BPS office. The pond which formed today was nearly a foot deep and the suction created by the drains beneath the water may be significant. Please avoid parking in this area, and instruct your children to stay away from the standing water. Let's keep everyone safe!

Hope you are all staying warm and dry this evening.

Thank you,
Mr. Newman

post_text:
School staff recently participated in a training on new additions to the District's emergency response procedures. The changes are based on the latest information and research about school safety using Standard Response Protocols. More information about SRP may be found at the i love you guys Foundation home page: http://iluvuguys.org/

Next steps for the district include training the students, and practicing drills with students. Information will be sent home to parents, and be part of the Hawk Talk community meetings.

Safety has always been, and remains, top priority for everyone in Colusa Unified Schools.

SUPERINTENDENT SCHEDULES COMMUNITY MEETING

A meeting with the Colusa community is scheduled for the evening of November 14 from 6-7pm. Superintendent Dwayne Newman will facilitate a discussion of the following topics:

‚Ä¢Clarification of the District's Mission and Vision.
‚Ä¢The district's budget outlook post-election.
‚Ä¢Observations about district performance, and views from the audience.
‚Ä¢Creating a long-term dream for the future of CUSD.
There will be time for questions from the audience.

Everyone is invited. Location is not yet determined. Check back here for further information.

Drive 4UR School!

Hoblit Motors will be hosting a Drive 4UR School fundraiser at Colusa High School, October 17th from 10am to 5pm. For each test-drive Ford Motor will donate $20 dollars to Colusa High for a new P.A. system in the school gym.

Up to $6,000 can be donated for test-drives and up to an additional $2,000 for test drives in the all new Ford Escape. There is no cost to take a test drive. Only one driver per address and must be 18 or older with a valid driver‚Äôs license.
